Class Regex

  • java.lang.Object
    • Regex

  • class Regex
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Regex retains information about regex patters. Implementing value must suits to requirements - otherwise creating new object will be terminated or user will have to input new data till conditions will be fulfilled.
    Version:
    2.0 15.03.2018
    Author:
    Magdalena Wisniewska

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern barCodePattern
      barCodePattern allows to add writing with exactly 13 digits and first of them can not be 0.
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern bigSmallLettersPattern
      bigSmallLettersPattern allows to add writing with small and big letters without polish signs.
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern datePattern
      datePattern allows to add writing in format : "yyyy.mm.dd".
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern moneyPattern1
      moneyPattern1 allows to add writing with max 7 digits (min 1 digit), dot and exactly 2 digits directly after dot.
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern moneyPattern2
      moneyPattern2 allows to add writing with max 8 digits (min 1 digit), dot and exactly 1 digit directly after dot.
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern moneyPattern3
      moneyPattern3 allows to add writing with max 9 digits (min 1 digit).
      (package private) static java.util.regex.Pattern phoneNumberPattern
      phoneNumberPattern allows to add writing with digits and "+" sign.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • bigSmallLettersPattern

        static java.util.regex.Pattern bigSmallLettersPattern
        bigSmallLettersPattern allows to add writing with small and big letters without polish signs. It checks correctness of name, surname, city, country from Customer class.

      • phoneNumberPattern

        static java.util.regex.Pattern phoneNumberPattern
        phoneNumberPattern allows to add writing with digits and "+" sign. It checks correctness of phoneNumber from Customer class.

      • datePattern

        static java.util.regex.Pattern datePattern
        datePattern allows to add writing in format : "yyyy.mm.dd". It checks correctness of orderDate from Order class.

      • moneyPattern1

        static java.util.regex.Pattern moneyPattern1
        moneyPattern1 allows to add writing with max 7 digits (min 1 digit), dot and exactly 2 digits directly after dot. It is one from tree acceptable patterns which checks correctness of originalPrice from Item class, extraCost from Order class and averageItemPrice from Quantity class.

      • moneyPattern2

        static java.util.regex.Pattern moneyPattern2
        moneyPattern2 allows to add writing with max 8 digits (min 1 digit), dot and exactly 1 digit directly after dot. It is one from tree acceptable patterns which checks correctness of originalPrice from Item class, extraCost from Order class and averageItemPrice from Quantity class.

      • moneyPattern3

        static java.util.regex.Pattern moneyPattern3
        moneyPattern3 allows to add writing with max 9 digits (min 1 digit). It is one from tree acceptable patterns which checks correctness of originalPrice from Item class, extraCost from Order class and averageItemPrice from Quantity class.

      • barCodePattern

        static java.util.regex.Pattern barCodePattern
        barCodePattern allows to add writing with exactly 13 digits and first of them can not be 0. It checks correctness of barCode from Item class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Regex

        Regex()
